description:
Fashionable and friendly Yuzu Aihara is ready to face her brand-new school and find her first love. The only problem? It's an all-girls' school. Determined to make a good impression and lots of friends, Yuzu puts on her best looks—only to wind up in trouble on day-one! After a close encounter by the beautiful yet harsh student council president Mei and having her phone confiscated, Yuzu is losing hope that this will be a perfect high school story. But nothing compares to the shock when she gets home to find out Mei is her brand-new stepsister—who suddenly kisses her! With her heart beating wildly and her emotions a complete mess, Yuzu wonders something: Is she falling for Mei?

Torn between being a good stepsister and dealing with her feelings, Yuzu does everything she can to become close to Mei. But can she melt the ice around Mei's heart and heal the pain she hides?

(Source: Funimation)

tags.name: Yuri
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two females, not inherently sexual. Also known as Girls' Love.

tags.name: Inseki
tags.description: Features sexual or romantic relations among step, adopted, and other non-blood related family members.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Psychosexual
tags.description: Work that involves the psychological aspects of sexual impulses.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Cohabitation
tags.description: Features two or more people who live in the same household and develop a romantic or sexual relationship.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Gyaru
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who has a distinct American-emulated fashion style, such as tanned skin, bleached hair, and excessive makeup. Also known as gal.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Bisexual
tags.description: Features a character who is romantically or sexually attracted to people of more than one sex or gender.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Teacher
tags.description: Protagonist is an educator, usually in a school setting.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

node.description: Originally an animator. Often works with [Hijiri Sanpei](https://anilist.co/staff/149565/).

[Website](http://nanoripe.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/nanoripe_info) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/nano.ripe/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCL-qIf8MciqDx0VJsQDIsHw)

__Formed:__ 1998
__Genres:__ J-POP, Rock (Pop Rock)

__Introduction:__
nano.RIPE is a two-piece Japanese pop rock band under record label Lantis (2010–), affiliated with the entertainment office Highway Star. 

__Biography:__
The band was formed in 1998 with the members Kimiko and Jun who were classmates in their prefectural high school in Chiba. They debuted as an indie band in 2008, releasing one single and three albums before they eventually made their major debut in 2010, while also signing to record label Lantis in the same year.

__Members:__
- [Kimiko](https://anilist.co/staff/169452/Kimiko) (季美子, きみコ) – vocalist, guitarist, in-charge of lyrics (1998–)
- [Sasaki Jun](https://anilist.co/staff/169454/Jun-Sasaki) (佐々木淳, ササキジュン) – guitarist, chorus, in-charge of composition (1998–)

__Former Members:__
- [Abe Nobuyuki](https://twitter.com/nob_abe) (アベノブユキ) – bassist (2010–2016)
- Yuuki Aoyama (青山友樹) – drummer (2013–2016) ([deceased](https://natalie.mu/music/news/298104))
- shinn. – drummer (–2011)

__Support Members:__
- [Hiroki Takahashi](https://twitter.com/takahashi_drum) (高橋宏貴) – drummer
- [Abe Nobuyuki](https://twitter.com/nob_abe) (アベノブユキ) – bassist
- [Naoya "choku" Suzuki](https://twitter.com/choku_nary) (鈴木"choku"直也) – bassist
- [Takumi Sugama](https://twitter.com/sugamatakumi) (菅間匠) – drummer
Members: Waka Kirishima (霧島若歌), Fuuri Uebana (上花楓裏), Risuko Sasakama (ささかまリス子)

__[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100003558003913)__

__Residency:__ Fujisawa, Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan
__Graduated:__ Kugenuma High School, Yoyogi Animation Academy

__Aiko Matsuyama__ is a Japanese color designer and digital painter, who mainly does finishing.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yuka_1106)

**Yuuka Sakurai** is a Japanese producer, animation planner and music producer working at Lantis. She is also director of music production at Bandai Namco Arts Inc. since April 1, 2018.

__[Profile (Lantis)](https://www.lantis.jp/artist/Void_Chords/bio.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/RyoTakahashi111)__

__Ryo Takashi__, alternatively known as Void_Chords, is a Japanese composer, arranger, music producer, bassist and DJ. He also works with the doujin group FELT under the alias Maurits "ZEN" Cornelis.

**Residency:** Nerima, Tokyo, Japan
**Graduated:** Meiji University

**[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/tr.netamemo)** | **[Twitter](https://twitter.com/netamemo)**

**Yoshie Terushige** is a Japanese producer who works for the company Lantis.
